abstracts.cdata!:
Through this Second Parapublic Technical
            Assistance Project, Senegal hopes to improve the efficiency
            of its public enterprises and help reduce the public sector
            deficit.  To achieve these objectives, the project aims to
            provide:  (i) technical assistance to key enterprises for
            the development and implementation of rehabilitation
            programs.  It will also; (ii) help selected enterprises to
            finance audits and accounting assistance while; (iii)
            developing and implementing training programs at local
            educational institutions.  Specifically, the project
            provides for:  (a) management consultant services to 12
            enterprises for the preparation of rehabilitation programs;
            as well as (b) part of the costs of audits for ten
            enterprises and accounting assistance along with limited
            review audits for about 30 smaller enterprises.  It also
            includes; (c) long-term advisors for government oversight
            agencies; (d) consultant assistance for an assessment of
            training needs as well as faculty support for the national
            management training institution.  Finally, there are funds
            for; (e) overseas training; (f) consultant assistance for
            development of new auditing and accounting standards; and
            (g) studies relating to the scope, organization and
            management of the parapublic sector.
